Class Ship

java.lang.Object
  Ship

public class Ship
extends java.lang.Object

Ship is the class to hold all the attributes of a client's ship. A ship object is created by giving a ship ID and ship type. Initial x and y positions can also be given.

integer value for the ship type "Man Of War" = 2

Constant Field Values

public static final int FRIGATE
integer value for the ship type "Frigate" = 1

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SLOOP

public static final int SLOOP
integer value for the ship type "Sloop" = 0

See Also:
Constant Field Values

shipID

public int shipID
Ship id of this ship. A unique number is assigned by the server to each ship.

shipName

public java.lang.String shipName
Name of this ship as requested by the client. default: "null"

shipType

public int shipType
Type of this ship.
  • Sloop = 0
  • Frigate = 1
  • Man of War = 2

    • length

    public int length
    Length of this ship.
  • Sloop = 40m
  • Frigate = 60m
  • Man of War = 80m

    • width

    public int width
    Width of this ship. All ships types are 20m wide.

    hitChance

    public double hitChance
    Hit chance of this ship
  • Sloop = 33.33%
  • Frigate = 66.67%
  • Man of War = 83.33%

    • speedFactor

    public int speedFactor
    Speed factor of this ship.
  • Sloop = 90
  • Frigate = 70
  • Man of War = 50

    • turningFactor

    public int turningFactor
    Turning factor of this ship
  • Sloop = 3
  • Frigate = 2
  • Man of War = 1

    • health

    public float health
    Current health of this ship. 0 = destroyed

    Starting health:

  • Sloop = 3
  • Frigate = 4
  • Man of War = 5

    • heading

    public int heading
    Current direction this ship is facing in degrees. Values of 0-359 where 0 is north and increasing values turns the direction in a clockwise fashion.

    Default value is 135 which points it SE (assumes start at NW corner of map)

    xPos

    public double xPos
    Current x-position of this ship in metres. default = 10m (0 = left side of the map)

    yPos

    public double yPos
    Current y-position of this ship in metres. default = 10m (0 = top of the map)

    actualSpeed

    public int actualSpeed
    Current speed of this ship in metres/second. default = 0m/s (0 = not moving)

    speedSetting

    public double speedSetting
    Current speed setting of this ship. This value is a percentage of maximum speed as requested by the client. Expressed in decimal form.
  • Default = 0%
  • 100% = Maximum speed possible
  • 0% = Not moving

    • Constructor Detail

    Ship

    public Ship(int newShipID,
            int newShipType)
    Constructor to make a ship object. Requires the id and type of the ship.

    Parameters:
    newShipID - id of the ship
    newShipType - type of the ship

    Ship

    public Ship(int newShipID,
            int newShipType,
            int newXPos,
            int newYPos)
    Constructor to make a ship object. Requires the id and type of the ship as well as the initial x and y positions in metres.

    Parameters:
    newShipID - id of the ship
    newShipType - type of the ship
    newXPos - initial x position in metres
    newYPos - initial y position in metres
    Method Detail

    getHeading

    public int getHeading()
    Converts the current heading of the ship to the client's convention. The ship's heading is stored as a value between 0 and 359 (inclusive where 0 is north). The client views the ship's heading as a value between -180 and 180 (inclusive where 0 is north)

    Returns:
    the heading of the ship in -180 to 180 so it can be sent to the client

    getXPos

    public int getXPos()
    Used to get the x position of the ship as an integer. The x position is stored as a double to ensure that small position updates aren't rounded down to nothing but the msg protocol uses integers for position. This method returns the x position value after it has been rounded and cast to an int.

    Returns:
    x position of the ship rounded and cast to int

    getYPos

    public int getYPos()
    Used to get the y position of the ship as an integer. The y position is stored as a double to ensure that small position updates aren't rounded down to nothing but the msg protocol uses integers for position. This method returns the y position value after it has been rounded and cast to an int.

    Returns:
    y position of the ship rounded and cast to int

    main

    public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
    Main method used only for testing this class individually.

    Parameters:
    args - not used
